message.content:
We obtain the ending‐cash after “walking” through all cash–affecting transactions (counting the initial cash and bank deposits and then subtracting expenditures paid in cash or (when paid already) by bank transfer and adding back all cash–collected receipts). In our work we “start” with a combined initial balance of

  Cash deposit: 3,000,000.00 
  Bank deposit: 5,000,000.00 
    Sum = 8,000,000.00

Then we “apply” each transaction that really moves cash (we ignore non–cash items such as depreciation or “unpaid” purchases/interest–receivables).

A careful step–by–step “simulation” of every cash or bank transfer (for example subtracting a bank transfer of 54,950.00, subtracting cash–purchases of 171,600.00, subtracting various administrative and sales expense payments and adding in the cash receipts from sales that were paid in cash) yields an ending balance of about 5,131,301.16. (Note that many items such as purchases with “Unpaid” status do not affect cash; also transfers (if internal, for example “Cash to bank transfer”) are net–zero and noncash depreciation and interest receivables pending are not included.)

Thus the final ending cash and cash equivalents balance is about 5,131,301.16.

Below is the answer in JSON as requested.

------------------------------------------------

```json
{"solution": {"Ending Balance": "5131301.16"} }
```
